com.guidewire.pl.plugin.validation
Class FieldValidationData

java.lang.Object
  com.guidewire.pl.plugin.validation.FieldValidationData
All Implemented Interfaces:
GWRemotable
public class FieldValidationData
extends java.lang.Object
implements GWRemotable

Stores validation data for an individual field related to the entity being validated. The field isn't necessarily directly on the entity being validated; it can be related through foreign keys and/or arrays.

Note that you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

Constructor Detail

FieldValidationData

public FieldValidationData()
Method Detail

getBeanPath

public java.lang.String getBeanPath()
Path to the bean to be validated from the root entity. This field is optional - it allows integration code to reject sub-fields in a manner parallel to the rule action ValidationAction.rejectSubField. If this field is blank, then the root entity will be the bean that is validated.

setBeanPath

public void setBeanPath(java.lang.String beanPath)
Path to the bean to be validated from the root entity. This field is optional - it allows integration code to reject sub-fields in a manner parallel to the rule action ValidationAction.rejectSubField. If this field is blank, then the root entity will be the bean that is validated.

getFieldPath

public java.lang.String getFieldPath()
Path to the field from the validated entity. A field path can traverse foreign keys and/or arrays.

Examples:

  • Field directly on validate entity:
    • "LossType" is the path to the LossType field on the Claim to be validated.
  • o Field on related entity:
    • "Policy.PolicyType" is the path to the PolicyType of the Policy associated with the Claim being validated.
  • Field on array element:
    • "Exposures[0].LossCategory" is the path to the LossCategory of the first Exposure associated with the claim being validated.
    • "LineItems[0].Amount" is the path to the Amount of the first transaction line item associated with the Transaction being validated.

setFieldPath

public void setFieldPath(java.lang.String fieldPath)
Path to the field from the validated entity. A field path can traverse foreign keys and/or arrays.

Examples:

  • Field directly on validate entity:
    • "LossType" is the path to the LossType field on the Claim to be validated.
  • o Field on related entity:
    • "Policy.PolicyType" is the path to the PolicyType of the Policy associated with the Claim being validated.
  • Field on array element:
    • "Exposures[0].LossCategory" is the path to the LossCategory of the first Exposure associated with the claim being validated.
    • "LineItems[0].Amount" is the path to the Amount of the first transaction line item associated with the Transaction being validated.
